feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 4 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 1 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator has complex calculation logic with multiple configuration challenges and potential inconsistencies across different payroll scenarios.
findings.issue_explanation: Users encounter difficulties with calculation methods, especially around handling working days, leap years, and different salary components.
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot flexibly adapt daily wage calculations across different leave and salary proration scenarios.
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparent, configurable daily wage calculation methods that can handle varied organizational requirements.

findings.group_description: Global configurations can override policy-level daily wage calculation settings, creating potential misunderstandings and unexpected results.
findings.issue_explanation: System-wide settings can supersede individual policy configurations for daily wage calculations.
findings.limitation_statement: Users cannot easily customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when global settings exist.
findings.gap_statement: Need for more transparent configuration hierarchy and user controls for daily wage calculations.

findings.group_description: Salary and leave proration calculations produce inconsistent results due to varying divisor methods and configuration challenges.
findings.issue_explanation: Different calculation methods for daily wage lead to unexpected deduction amounts and user confusion.
findings.limitation_statement: The system uses different divisors (30, 30.42, working days) that can produce varying results.
findings.gap_statement: Need for a unified, configurable daily wage calculation approach across different payroll scenarios.

findings.group_description: Current system struggles with accurately calculating service periods and gratuity during leap years.
findings.issue_explanation: Calculation logic does not consistently handle 366-day years, leading to potential benefit miscalculations.
findings.limitation_statement: Platform cannot automatically adjust calculations for leap years in service period and benefit computations.
findings.gap_statement: Need for robust leap year handling in daily wage and service duration calculations.

troubleshooting.group_description: When calculation discrepancies occur, manual intervention or system-specific workarounds are required.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: 1. Delete and recreate leave requests to trigger recalculation. 2. Manually adjust deductions to reconcile differences. 3. Verify global and policy-level daily wage configurations.

glossary.definition: Calculation of an employee's per-day salary rate, typically computed by dividing total salary by a specific number of days (30, 30.42, or working days).
Days considered as working in a month, which may exclude weekends and public holidays based on specific work week configurations.
